Package com.atakmap.android.toolbar

Interface IToolbarExtension2

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DrawingToolsToolbar, FiresToolbar, GridToolbar, RangeAndBearingToolbar, RouteToolbarBroadcastReceiver
    public interface IToolbarExtension2

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getToolbarIcon()
      Implement this method show the appropriate active tool icon in the toolbar.
      ActionBarView getToolbarView()
      Implement this method to return the view that should be placed in the toolbar drawer when your component has control of it.
      java.util.List<Tool> getTools()
      Deprecated.
      Use getToolbarView() instead.
      boolean hasToolbar()
      Implement this method to tell ToolbarLibrary whether your component will sometimes take control of the toolbar's contents or whether it only implements tools without implementing a toolbar.
      void onToolbarVisible​(boolean vis)  

    • Method Detail

      • getToolbarIcon

        android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getToolbarIcon()
        Implement this method show the appropriate active tool icon in the toolbar.
        Returns:
        the drawable associated with the toolbar icon.

      • getTools

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.1",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="4.4")
java.util.List<Tool> getTools()
        Deprecated.
        Use getToolbarView() instead.
        Implement this method to return a set of tools to be managed by ToolbarLibrary.
        Returns:
        A list of tools

      • getToolbarView

        ActionBarView getToolbarView()
        Implement this method to return the view that should be placed in the toolbar drawer when your component has control of it.
        Returns:
        the action bar view for the tool

      • hasToolbar

        boolean hasToolbar()
        Implement this method to tell ToolbarLibrary whether your component will sometimes take control of the toolbar's contents or whether it only implements tools without implementing a toolbar.
        Returns:
        if it has a corresponding tool bar

      • onToolbarVisible

        void onToolbarVisible​(boolean vis)
